svcproc.title: MANUAL PROGRAMMING
svcproc.para: The speedometer DIP switches are located on the top edge of the cluster and can be accessed by pulling the cluster out of the instrument panel, Figure 10.

calloutgroup.callout1: SWITCH 1. LEFT SIDE DIP SWITCH BANK
SWITCH 2. RIGHT SIDE DIP SWITCH BANK
4. TEN SPEEDOMETER SETTING SWITCHES (1-8 ON LEFT, 1-2 ON RIGHT)
5. ONE AXLE RATIO SETTING SWITCH (3 ON RIGHT)
6. THREE TACHOMETER SETTING SWITCHES (4-5-6 ON RIGHT)
7. ONE TACHOMETER RANGE SWITCH (7 ON RIGHT)
8. ONE ENGLISH-METRIC CONVERSION SWITCH (8 ON RIGHT)

important.para:
At the assembly plant, all the DIP switches are set at 0, and the speedometer and tachometer are programmed electronically. The speedometer and tachometer receive the proper setting, but the switch levers remain on 0. Moving any of the DIP switches from the 0 position disables the speedometer and tachometer programming. If a DIP switch is moved for re-programming or any other reason, then all the DIP switches must be moved to the positions indicated on the vehicle's line set ticket.
This information may also be found on a label, Figure 11, affixed to the top of the cluster. If all the switches are returned to 0, the original factory programmed settings will be re-enabled.

svcproc.para: There will be two (2) banks of DIP switches visible. Ten switches, the left bank of eight (8) switches and two (2) switches on the left end of the right bank, Item 4, Figure 10 , are required to manually program the speedometer. The number eight (8) switch on the right bank is for setting the odometer between English and metric readings, Item 8, Figure 10 . For miles per hour (MPH), the setting should be down (0). For a kilometers per hour (KPH) speedometer, the setting should be up (1).

The third switch position (Item 5, Figure 10) on the right DIP switch bank is for calibration of the two available two-speed axle ratios. These are 1.36:1 (switch in the 0 setting or down position) and 1.39:1 (switch at the 1 setting or up position). If the vehicle does not have a two-speed axle, the switch is inactive.

important.para: The speedometer and tachometer settings must be manually programmed when tire sizes and/or rear axle ratios are changed or a replacement cluster is installed.
